nl.fw.yapool.sql

Class SimpleQueryBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.fw.yapool.sql.SimpleQueryBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IQueryBuilder

    public class SimpleQueryBuilder
extends Object
implements IQueryBuilder
    A IQueryBuilder that uses the given sql-IDs as sql-statements. Overload the methods to provide specific behavior for special sql-IDs.
    Author:
    Fred

    • Method Detail

      • getQueryByName

        public String getQueryByName(String queryName)
        Looks up the query associated with the query name. If there is no query associated with the query name, the query name is returned. The latter allows the use of (rarely used) queries without a name, where the name is the query.

      • getQueryMap

        public Map<String,String> getQueryMap()
        Map containing query names and their associated queries.

      • addGeneratesKeys

        public boolean addGeneratesKeys(String queryName,
                       boolean named)
        Fills the sets used by hasGeneratedKeys(String, boolean).

      • hasGeneratedKeys

        public boolean hasGeneratedKeys(String queryName,
                       boolean named)
        Determines if a query returns generated keys. Uses genKeyPreparedStatement and genKeyNamedParameterStatement.
        Parameters:
        queryName - The query name/ID.
        named - True for a named parameter statement, false for a prepared statement.
        Returns:
        True if the statement should return generated keys.

      • loadQueries

        public static LinkedHashMap<String,String> loadQueries(Reader in)
                                                throws IOException
        Calls loadQueries(Reader, Map) with an empty query map and returns the query map after loading the queries.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • loadQueries

        public static void loadQueries(Reader in,
               Map<String,String> qmap)
                        throws IOException
        Loads queries form a sql-file/inputstream. Queries must be formatted using the QUERY_NAME_MARKER in the following manner: 
        -- Just a comment
// Also a comment
-- Empty start tag, query will get query-count as ID (in this case "1").
--[]
select something from somehwere
-- End-tag for query (optional).
--[/]
-- Query with name INSERT_ITEM
--[INSERT_ITEM]
insert into items (item_key, item) values (@itemKey, @item)
-- If end-tag is used the name in end-tag must match start-tag, e.g. --[/INSERT_ITEM].
-- End-tag is optional, start-tag below marks end for INSERT_ITEM query
--[BIG_QUERY]
select a, b,c 
from x, y, z
where this=that and other=stuff
--[/BIG_QUERY]
-- Last end-tag is also optional (end of document marks end for BIG_QUERY)
        All text between begin and end tag is not formatted in any way and taken literally as the query, but a line is skipped if it is empty, starts with -- (but not "--[" which is the tag-marker) or starts with //.
        Parameters:
        in - The characters to parse (stream is NOT closed by this method).
        qmap - The map that will contain the query names/IDs and queries.
        Throws:
        IOException - if formatting is incorrect.
